resources.string: Addition is bringing two or more numbers (or things) together to make a new total
Here 2 balls are added to 1 ball to make 3 balls
In Words : Two plus one equals three
Subtraction is taking one number away from another.
Your friend borrowed this red ball
Now you have green and blue ball
In Words : Three minus one equals two

Mathematics:

Each Right answer wins you one point.
You get 30 seconds to earn maximum points with right answers.

English:

You get one point on getting the right answer on your first attempt.

Note: Active Internet Connection is needed to update and upload your score.

Scores of Top 10 students will be published on leaderboard.

Multiplication is one of the four elementary mathematical operations of arithmetic, with the other ones being addition, subtraction and division.\nThe basic idea of multiplication is repeated addition.
In Words : Three times two equals six

Wittyape is a free self–driven learning management system that offers highly personalised and effective learning programs for classes 1 to 4 for CBSE, ICSE and other boards to help them learn by practice. The app and website provide multiple questions to learn and engage with their subject by solving interactive exercises to test their learning. Our products are carefully designed to ensure maximum learning through proven techniques such as adaptive learning.

Welcome to Wittyape!

These terms and conditions outline the rules and regulations for the use of Wittyape's App/Website.
By accessing this app/website we assume you accept these terms and conditions. Do not continue to use Wittyape if you do not agree to take all of the terms and conditions stated on this page.
All terms refer to the offer, acceptance and consideration of payment necessary to undertake the process of our assistance to the Client in the most appropriate manner for the express purpose of meeting the Client’s needs in respect of provision of the Company’s stated services, in accordance with and subject to, prevailing laws. Any use of the above terminology or other words in the singular, plural, capitalization and/or he/she or they, are taken as interchangeable and therefore as referring to the same.

License

Unless otherwise stated, Wittyape and/or its licensors own the intellectual property rights for all material on Wittyape. All intellectual property rights are reserved. You may access this from Wittyape for your own personal use subjected to restrictions set in these terms and conditions.
You must not:
1 Republish material from Wittyape
2 Sell, rent or sub-license material from Wittyape
3 Reproduce, duplicate or copy material from Wittyape
4 Redistribute content from Wittyape. 

Content Liability

We shall not be held responsible for any content that appears on your App. You agree to protect and defend us against all claims that are rising on your App/Website. No link(s) should appear on any App/Website that may be interpreted as libelous, obscene or criminal, or which infringes, otherwise violates, or advocates the infringement or other violation of, any third party rights.

Reservation of Rights

We reserve the right to request that you remove all links or any particular link to our App/Website. You approve to immediately remove all links to our App/Website upon request. We also reserve the right to amend these terms and conditions and it’s linking policy at any time. By continuously linking to our App/Website, you agree to be bound to and follow these linking terms and conditions. 

Removal of users

If you find any username on our App that is offensive for any reason, you are free to contact and inform us at any moment. We will consider requests to remove the user but we are not obligated to or so or to respond to you directly.
We do not ensure that the information on this app/website is correct, we do not warrant its completeness or accuracy; nor do we promise to ensure that the app/website remains available or that the material on the website is kept up to date.

Your Privacy

Please read Privacy Policy

Consent

By using our app/website, you hereby consent to our Privacy Policy and agree to its terms. 

Information we collect

The personal information that you are asked to provide, and the reasons why you are asked to provide it, will be made clear to you at the point we ask you to provide your personal information.
If you contact us directly, we may receive additional information about you such as your name, email address, phone number, the contents of the message and/or attachments you may send us, and any other information you may choose to provide.
When you register for an Account, we may ask for your contact information, including items such as name, company name, address, email address, and telephone number.

Log Files

Wittyape follows a standard procedure of using log files. These files log visitors when they visit app/websites. All hosting companies do this and a part of hosting services analytics. The information collected by log files include date and time stamp. These are not linked to any information that is personally identifiable. The purpose of the information is for analyzing trends, administering the app/site, tracking users movement on the app/website, and gathering demographic information.

GDPR Data Protection Rights

We would like to make sure you are fully aware of all of your data protection rights. Every user is entitled to the following:
The right to rectification – You have the right to request that we correct any information you believe is inaccurate. You also have the right to request that we complete the information you believe is incomplete.
The right to erasure – You have the right to request that we erase your personal data, under certain conditions.
The right to restrict processing – You have the right to request that we restrict the processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.
The right to object to processing – You have the right to object to our processing of your personal data, under certain conditions.
The right to data portability – You have the right to request that we transfer the data that we have collected to another organization, or directly to you, under certain conditions.
If you make a request, we have one month to respond to you. If you would like to exercise any of these rights, please contact us.

Children Information

Another part of our priority is adding protection for children while using the internet. We encourage parents and guardians to observe, participate in, and/or monitor and guide their online activity.
Wittyape does not knowingly collect any Personal Identifiable Information from children under the age of 13. If you think that your child provided this kind of information on our website, we strongly encourage you to contact us immediately and we will do our best efforts to promptly remove such information from our records.

The information contained in this platform is for general educational purposes only. We make no representations or warranties of any kind, about the completeness, accuracy, reliability, suitability or availability with respect to the application/website or the information, products, services, or related graphics contained on the application/website for any purpose. Any reliance you place on such information is therefore strictly at your own risk.\nIn no event will we be liable for any loss or damage including without limitation, indirect or consequential loss or damage, or any loss or damage whatsoever arising from loss of data or profits arising out of, or in connection with, the use of this application/website.

Enter the baby name of the animal:
Find the adjective in the sentence:
Identify the article in the sentence:
Write down the plural of the word:
Which letter is silent in the word:
Write the name of sound this animal makes:
Identify the verb in the sentence:
Identify words with degree of comparison:

Here’s a list of some baby animal names:

Cat - kitten
Tiger - cub
Deer - fawn
Chicken - chick
Dog - puppy
Duck - duckling
Lion - cub
Pig - piglet
Sheep - lamb
Monkey - infant

Antonym is a word opposite in meaning to another.

Here’s a list of a few antonyms-

Hot - Cold
Few - Many
East - West
Man - Woman
Win - Lose
Black - White
Question - Answer
Hard - Easy
Poor - Rich
Little - Big

A word that describes a noun or pronoun is an adjective.
In the sentence ‘This shop has the best samosas’, ‘best’ is an adjective.

Let’s see a few more examples of how adjectives are used in sentences.

The dog found a large bone.
large
She wore a beautiful dress.
beautiful
Shashi is a good man.
good
This glass is strong.
strong
This is a big box.
big
My job is worse than yours.
worse
Shashi is really clever.
clever
The doctor is late.
late
The house is bigger than other ones.
bigger
He is angry.
angry

"English has two articles: the and a/an. A/an is used to modify nouns, whereas the is used to refer to nouns.

Here’s how we use them in sentences:

Using - a

I need a book.
They bought a computer.
My friend has a pet dog.
She saw a movie last night.

Using - an

Shashi has an idea.
She ate an apple.
I eat an apple everyday.
He is an honest person.

Using - the

The Moon rotates around the Earth.
The sun is brighter than the Moon "

Plural denotes a quantity more than one.

Here’s a list of some few plural words:

Puppy - puppies
Tooth - teeth
Mouse - mice
Man - men
Woman - women
City - cities
Spy - spies
Baby - babies
Wolf - wolves
Knife - knives

A silent letter is a letter that does not correspond to any sound in the word's pronunciation.

Here are a few examples of words with their silent letters.

Knee - k
Two - w
Where - h
Nestle - t
Lamb - b
Bomb - b
School - h
Honest - h
Match - t
Listen - t

Here’s a list of a some other animal sound names.

Fox - yelp
Bull - bellow
Bee - buzz
Owl - hoot

Verbs are the action words in a sentence that describe what the subject is doing.

To help you understand with ease, we have identified verbs in the sentences.

The baby is playing with blocks.
playing
My mom cooks a yummy meal every day.
cooks
We began to climb the hill.
climb
She is drawing a picture
drawing
He writes his name on the desk.
writes
She ran across the garden.
ran
The Sun rises from the East.
rises
Birds build their nests.
build
They play with a ball.
play
The boy closed the door.
closed

Adjectives describe a quality or characteristic of a noun or pronoun. The basic form of an adjective is known as positive degree.
Adjectives can be changed to compare a quality between two nouns, this form is known as the comparative degree.
We can also change an adjective to identify a noun with the highest degree of an attribute among a group, this is known as the superlative degree.

Example of Positive to Comparative degree

Tall - more tall
Big - bigger
Small - smaller

Example of Positive to Superlative degree

Tall - tallest
Big - biggest
Small - smallest
